channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Even on Election Day, Schumer Is Mum on Mamdani
item.description: The top Senate Democrat never endorsed Zohran Mamdani, his party’s young left-wing nominee for mayor, and declined to even say who he had voted for.

item.title: Gen Z dreams of a ‘Ralph Lauren Christmas’ in a dollar store American economy
item.description: A "Ralph Lauren Christmas" doesn't have to be sourced from a Ralph Lauren store. It's more a state of mind, and it's more popular than ever.

item.title: Trump’s former trade architect says the president can’t backtrack on tariffs because he’s ‘too committed’ now: ‘That would be a pretty horrific decision’
item.description: The Supreme Court will begin hearing arguments Wednesday over whether President Donald Trump overstepped by using emergency powers to impose tariffs o...

item.title: Roelof Botha steps aside as Sequoia’s steward, passing the role to Alfred Lin and Pat Grady
item.description: After nearly a decade at the helm of Sequoia Capital, Roelof Botha will step aside as “steward” of the legendary Silicon Valley VC firm.

item.title: Some Republicans Honor Dick Cheney, While Trump Remains Silent
item.description: The late vice president had called President Trump “a coward” and a “threat to our republic” and supported Vice President Kamala Harris in 2024.

item.title: Altcoin giant Animoca Brands aims to go public next year, listing will test investor appetite for exotic crypto assets
item.description: Animoca plans to float share on Nasdaq starting in 2026

item.title: TikTok and Optimism: How Rob Jetten Won Over the Netherlands
item.description: Sleek social media posts and a shift rightward on immigration helped a center-left party win last week’s election. But can its leader, Mr. Jetten, for...

item.title: Dick Cheney, Powerful Vice President and Washington Insider, Dies at 84
item.description: A former defense secretary and congressman, he held the nation’s No. 2 job under President George W. Bush and was an architect of policies in an era o...

item.title: ‘You will see mass chaos. You will see mass flight delays. You’ll see mass cancellations’: Transportation Secretary desperate for shutdown to end
item.description: Sean Duffy said that a lot of his air traffic controllers can manage missing one paycheck, but two is another matter.

item.title: Elon Musk’s $1 Trillion Payday
item.description: My colleague Jack Ewing explains the stakes ahead of a crucial Tesla board meeting.

item.title: What to Know About the Legal Scandal in Israel Over Accusations of Abuse
item.description: The fallout from a legal case has reignited a highly charged debate within the country over whether Israeli soldiers accused of abusing Palestinians a...

item.title: Sara Terry, Photographer Who Captured War’s Aftermath, Dies at 70
item.description: Her haunting work focused on the lingering traces of conflict in places like Bosnia and Sierra Leone, after the firing had stopped.

item.title: Capitalism Is Constantly Reinventing Itself. That’s Why Things Feel So Volatile.
item.description: We are in the middle of the capitalistic order reinventing itself.
